beer.beer_description:
With whole-flower Celeia, Northdown and Aurora hops alongside malted barley and wheat, this is a Cornish twist on a classic smooth-drinking ale. The light malty aroma leads to a floral, even cedar taste, and a sharp tang of bitter grapefruit leaves a lasting impression; just like Betty herself…

The full-bodied, fun-loving character of Betty Stogs marched straight out of Cornish folklore to take her throne as the Queen of Cornish ales.

A quirky character yes, from Cornish folklore, Betty Stogs was reputedly full-bodied, golden-hearted and just a little fruity. So, you can see why we chose to name our award-winning, smooth-drinking amber ale after her.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 100 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 21!

items.badge_description: Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 35 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 8!

Whether you’re having a room party or hanging at the hotel bar, you know the essential part of any trip, an awesome beer!

That's a beer at 20 different venues categorized as a Hotel! Visit 5 more different ones for Level 5!

As the hub of the town's social scene, your local pub has what you're craving. Be sure to stop by for a pint or two! That's a beer at 110 different venues with the categories of Pub, Irish Pub or Gastropub. Visit 5 more for Level 23!

user.bio:
Ex Printer blissfully retired now 
Huge Brentford fc fan craft ale lover 
cheers
Former Regional Director of Central Southern Campaign for Real Ale (CAMRA). The first ever Cask Marque ambassador.
CAMRA. I tick beers not taste them.
